tibbleOne 0.1.0
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Getting started with tibbleOne

Reference

All functions

adapt_round()

round numeric values for presentation in a table

add_ft_footers()

add footers to a flextable tibbleOne object

add_ft_header()

add headers to flextable object using a kable header vector.

add_kable_header()

add headers to flextable object using a kable header vector.

add_pval_to_header()

add a p-value slot into the header for a kable object

build_meta()

creates a dataset that describes the characteristics of another dataset

capitalize()

capitalize the first letter of a string (copied from Hmisc)

catg_tbl_value()

generate table values for a categorical variable

check_tibble_one_input()

check to make sure that input variables are correctly structured

cmp_pval_noparm()

compute p-values from non-parametric tests

cmp_pval_params()

compute p-values for parametric tests

ctns_tbl_value()

generate mean and standard deviation values for a continuous variable

edit_pval()

format p-values for tables

find_indent_rows()

find which rows of a kibble object need to be indented

gen_tbl_value()

generate table one values for a column variable

get_abbrs()

If abbreviations for this column are null, return missing value. Otherwise, return the abbreviations for the column

get_groups()

If group of this column is null, return missing value. Otherwise, return the group of the column

get_label()

If var_label of this column is null, return col. Otherwise, return the var_label of the column

get_notes()

If note of this column is null, return missing value. Otherwise, return the notes for the column

get_units()

If unit of this column is null, return missing value. Otherwise, return the unit of the column

hline_header()

Creat line for merged cells in the header of the table

list_things()

easy lists of things

mean_sd()

compute mean and standard deviation of continuous variable

median_iqr()

compute median and specified percentiles of continuous variable

parse_flex_footers()

determine which type of symbols to use for flextable footnotes

parse_kable_headers()

create headers for kable objects created from tibble_one objects.

parse_specs()

specificy table values/tests

parse_tb1_formula()

tibbleOne formula handler

parse_unnamed_spec()

specificy table values/tests.

select_labelled()

create labels for variables in a dataframe, and then keep only the labelled columns

set_variable_labels() set_variable_groups() set_variable_abbrs() set_variable_notes() set_variable_units()

Set variable attributes

str_split_trim()

split, unlist, and trim a string based on a fixed pattern.

tibbleOne-package

tibbleOne: Because nobody likes making Table 1.

tibble_one()

make a tidy data frame with table one information

to_kable()

pass a tibble_one object into kable

to_word()

pass a tibble_one object into flextable

var_group()

get the group attribute of a variable

vibble()

turn a named vector into a wide tibble. This is similar to and connected with tibble::enframe. However, the vibble function will make a wider versus a longer tibble.

  • All functions
